dijkstras module¶

class dijkstras.Graph¶

Bases: object

A graph that consists of Nodes and their edge weights.

add_directed_edge(from_node, to_node, weight)¶

Adds a directed edge to the graph.

Parameters

  • from_node (Node) – the Node object at the tail of the directed edge

  • to_node (Node) – the Node object at the head of the directed edge

  • weight (float) – the edge weight

Returns

add_node(node)¶

Adds a node to the graph.

Parameters

node (Node) – the Node object to add

Returns

add_undirected_edge(from_node, to_node, weight)¶

Adds an undirected edge to the graph.

Parameters

  • from_node (Node) – the Node object at one end of the edge

  • to_node (Node) – the Node object at the other end of the edge

  • weight (float) – the edge weight

Returns

get_node(key)¶

Get the node object where the id matches the key.

Parameters

key (str) – the key to match the Node’s id

Returns

the Node object if found, None if not found

Return type

Node

reset()¶

Resets all the Nodes of the graph to their initial state.

Returns

class dijkstras.Node(id)¶

Bases: object

Node in a graph.

reset()¶

Resets the Node to its initial state.

Returns

dijkstras.build_graph(location_hash)¶

Builds the graph object from a Chaining Hash Table of Location objects.

Parameters

location_hash (ChainingHashTable[str, Location]) – the Chaining Hash Table of Location objects

Returns

the Graph object

Return type

Graph

dijkstras.get_shortest_path(g, start_node, end_node)¶

Gets the shortest path from the start node to the end node using Dijkstra’s algorithm.

Parameters

  • g (Graph) – the Graph object

  • start_node (Node) – the Start Node

  • end_node (Node) – the End Node

Returns

the path as a list in the order of Nodes visited, None if the start node or end node not in the graph

Return type

list[Node]

dijkstras.run_dijkstras(g, start_node)¶

Implements Dijkstra’s Algorithm on the graph.

Finds the shortest path from the start node to all other nodes in the graph.

Parameters

  • g (Graph) – the Graph object

  • start_node (Node) – the starting node

Returns
